DOC.brief_title: Different Analgesics Prior Intrauterine Device ( IUD ) Insertion : Is There Any Evidence ?
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized clinical control trial woman undergo IUD insertion . Participants study group randomly assign label opaque envelope either1 % lidocaine ( Xylocaine 1 % , Astra Zeneca , Egypt ) , misoprostol ( Sigma , Egypt ) , naproxen ( Naprosyn , Syntax , Egypt ) placebo tablet .
DOC.criteria: Patients consider eligible : 1. alert orient cooperative response visual analogue scale ( VAS ) . 2 . They sign inform consent participate clinical trial enter study . 3 . Willingness randomize complete study questionnaire . Participants exclude participation ineligible IUD accept criterion institution : 1 . A lidocaine allergy 2 . Copper allergy 3 . Current cervicitis 4 . Pelvic inflammatory disease ( PID ) within 3 month 5 . Uterine anomaly 6 . Pain medication within 6 hour insertion 7 . Misoprostol administration within 24 hour insertion 8 . History cervical surgery contraindication study medication .
